channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti on roundabout, 27th August
item.description:
Nationalistic graffiti on roundabout intended to intimidate refugees/asylum seekers being kept at local accomodation. This kind of thing is right out of the National Front/Britain First playbook and has no place in our borough. This graffiti as well as the illegally placed flags nearby at Nugent should be removed asap and the cameras used to hold those responsible accountable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85, Leesons Hill, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are no road markings on this streach of dual carraigeway , and have not been for months, there is no marking for traffic to stop at the lights ,hence it is strong danger to people crossing as car speed alone and dont know where to stop, many times going to far past, young children cross here for school. At a busy time .there are no markings along a long streach of the road, carag, 27th August
item.description:
Been like it for months , causing cars to bang into each other, there are 2 lanes but no marking, feel unsafe crossing at busy lights

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thames Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Bedroom furniture and household items fly tipped, 27th August
item.description:
Just watched the family from 10 Oslo Square fly tipp their household items and furniture. This family fly tipp at this site on a regular basis - is southwark council going to do something about this problematic family, that have been reported for fly tipping at this site, for many years now? Maybe the removal of the 'temporary ramp' (that was installed for the previous occupant and sadly passed years ago) would help in stopping the family from easily carrying items for dumping across the road onto the green space. Not only is it a constant eye saw for all neighbours, it's also the constant noise of dumping and the council collecting the rubbish that is disturbing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plover Way, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 226,by Peter warehouse, 27th August
